headline.main: Allied 'Commando' Raid Hits Japanese New Guinea Base; ALLIES SWOOP ON JAPANESE OUTPOST ALLIED LAND FORCE RAIDS NEW GUINEA

lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia, Wednesday, July 1 -- Allied land forces swooped down on Salamaua, Japan's largest invasion base in New Guinea, and "successfully engaged" the garrison in a hit-run raid, it was announced today. Striking swiftly and silently under cover of darkness, the raiders killed or wounded sixty Japanese troops and captured military equipment, then faded back into the jungle, a United Nations communique revealed.
abstract: Allied land forces stage Commando raid on Salamaua; planes raid Lae and Rabaul; Japanese bomb Mubo and Komeatum; map
